This was working! Now it is not.
<color color="red"> was recognized in my game, right up until I added clear screen to the "before entering script". Now it is not colouring the text. 

However, I just changed the colour script to a newer one, and it works, again.

Posts.EditableText:
The deprecated HTML would be `<font color="red">` …  but it's been recommended not to use that for years now.

The current "right" way to do color is with `<span style="color: red">` - which most browsers will automatically convert the above into.

The Quest text-processor code that generates that is `{colour:red:text goes here}`.

Posts.EditableText:
I won't use it again but it did actually seem to work - until it didn't. 

And I found it in the tutorials. Of course, I had gone there looking for it specifically, 
or rather the span style script, which I took it for,
 and didn't read the part above it and below it, that said which engines it could or could not be used with. 
It was here -
https://docs.textadventures.co.uk/quest/tutorial/text_formatting.html
 "This text is the current foreground colour, but <color color="red">this is red</color>."

I have switched over to the Quest text processor code, and everything is working well, now.
I guess I will just have to be more careful copying text without reading.
